summary: This is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney to Judge Nathan, with copies to Chambers, regarding the case US v. Maxwell (20 Cr. 330). It transmits the Government's request for redactions to filings related to the defendant's application for a Rule 17(c) subpoena and includes attachments with proposed redactions to filings from defense counsel and the law firm Boies Schiller Flexner LLP.

persons.name: Nathan
persons.context: The email is addressed to Judge Nathan, indicating she is presiding over the case US v. Maxwell.

persons.name: Maxwell
persons.context: The case is US v. Maxwell, indicating Ghislaine Maxwell is the defendant in the referenced criminal proceeding.

connections.description: Judge Nathan is presiding over the criminal case against defendant Maxwell, as indicated by the case caption US v. Maxwell.

events.title: Government Files Redaction Request
events.description: The Government submits a letter requesting redactions to filings regarding the defendant's application for a Rule 17(c) subpoena in the case US v. Maxwell.

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The document is a 2021 email from a federal prosecutor regarding the ongoing criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell.
The Government is requesting redactions to filings related to Maxwell's application for a Rule 17(c) subpoena.
The proposed redactions apply to filings from both defense counsel and the law firm Boies Schiller Flexner LLP.
The correspondence indicates active litigation and procedural motions concerning the protection of sensitive information in the case.
